The claim made by Rep: Sean Patrick Maloney was that most people on Medicaid are children, seniors, or have a disability.
The expert: s verdict cited enrollment data from 2016, which showed that 44.3 million Medicaid recipients were children, seniors, or had a disability, making up almost two-thirds of the Medicaid population.
The expert also mentioned that enrollmen: the latest official count, showed that those groups made up about 65 percent of the Medicaid population that year.
Additionally: the expert highlighted that Medicaid is used by seniors who need long-term care and cannot afford private insurance, as well as by people with disabilities who rely on the program for continuous care.
